message.content:
We must “build” the inventory by “adding” all the purchases (the items that arrive into stock) and “using up” some of that stock in sales (using the sale‐side “cost_amount” as the cost of goods sold). In our case no “Initial Inventory” was given (the Initial transactions in the file refer to cash, bank or fixed assets) so we assume that at the beginning the inventory was zero.

Step‑by‑step we do the following:

1. Identify the purchase transactions (those with type “Purchase” and that include a product ID, quantity and unit price). Their “amount” is the cost of the inventory bought. Adding these “Purchase” amounts we get:

 • Purchase20231231001: 200,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231002: 500,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231003: 70,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231004: 100,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231005: 35,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231006: 200,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231007: 180,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231008: 30,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231009: 50,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231010: 140,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231011: 100,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231012: 35,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231013: 45,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231014: 400,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231015: 120,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231016: 200,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231017: 450,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231018: 90,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231019: 15,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231020: 30,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231021: 160,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231022: 350,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231023: 35,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231024: 100,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231025: 450,000.00  
 • Purchase20231231026: 140,000.00  

Adding all those up yields a total purchase cost of 4,225,000.00.

2. Identify the “Sale” transactions that include a “cost_amount” column (this represents the cost of the goods that left inventory). (There are many sale rows in our dataset; summing up those “cost_amount” values gives a total cost of goods sold of 3,410,000.00.)

3. Then the inventory “balance‐sheet” value at end of period is obtained by

  Ending Inventory = Beginning Inventory + Purchases – Cost of Goods Sold  
  Since Beginning Inventory = 0.00,  
  Ending Inventory = 4,225,000.00 – 3,410,000.00 = 815,000.00

So our results are:

 • Inventory Initial Value: 0.00  
 • Inventory End Value: 815000.00

Below is the answer in the requested JSON format.

------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Inventory Initial Value": "0.00", "Inventory End Value": "815000.00"}}
